intro: Sterculia halmahairae, commonly known as the Halmahera Sterculia, is a unique plant native to the Maluku Islands of Indonesia. The plant produces showy, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, attracting various pollinators. Its fruit is a woody capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
